verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH1732>, when David and his men<WH582> were come<WH935> to Ziklag<WH6860> on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, that the Amalekites<WH6003> had invaded<WH6584> the south<WH5045>, and Ziklag<WH6860>, and struck<WH5221> Ziklag<WH6860>, and burned<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>;

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> at the Lord<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, Shall I pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> this troop<WH1416>? shall I overtake<WH5381> them<WH559>? So David<WH1732> went<WH3212>, he and the six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> that were with him<WH935>, and came to the brook<WH5158> Besor<WH1308>, where those that were left behind<WH3498> stayed<WH5975>.

But David<WH1732> pursued<WH7291>, he and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376>: for two hundred<WH3967> stayed behind<WH5975>, who were so faint<WH6296> that they could not go over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Besor<WH1308>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, To whom belongest you? and from where are you? And he said, I am a young man<WH5288> of Egypt<WH4713>, servant<WH5650> to an Amalekite<WH376>; and my master<WH113> left<WH5800> me<WH7969>, because three days<WH3117> ago I fell sick<WH2470>.

Then answered<WH6030> all the wicked<WH7451> men<WH376> and men of Belial<WH1100>, of those<WH582> that went<WH1980> with David<WH1732>, and said<WH559>, Because they went<WH1980> not with us<WH5414>, we will not give them anything of the plunder<WH7998> that we have recovered<WH5337>, save to every man<WH376> his wife<WH802> and his sons<WH1121>, that they may lead them away<WH5090>, and depart<WH3212>.

Then said<WH559> David<WH1732>, You shall not do so<WH6213>, my brothers<WH251>, with that which the Lord<WH3068> has given<WH5414> us<WH8104>, who has preserved us<WH5414>, and delivered the company<WH1416> that came<WH935> against us into our hand<WH3027>.

For who will listen<WH8085> unto you in this matter<WH1697>? but as his part<WH2506> is that goes down<WH3381> to the battle<WH4421>, so shall his part<WH2506> be that waits<WH3427> by the baggage<WH3627>: they shall share<WH2505> alike<WH3162>.
And it was so from that day<WH3117> forward<WH4605>, that he made<WH7760> it a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance<WH4941> for Israel<WH3478> unto this day<WH3117>.

To them<WH834> which were in Beth<WH1008>–el, and to them which were in south<WH5045> Ramoth<WH7418>, and to them which were in Jattir<WH3492>,
And to them which were in Aroer<WH6177>, and to them which were in Siphmoth<WH8224>, and to them which were in Eshtemoa<WH851>,
